intro: Zannichellia pedicellata var. pedunculata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf water plantain, is a aquatic plant characterized by its elongated, narrow leaves that are typically submerged in water. It belongs to the family Alismataceae and is native to temperate regions of Europe and Asia. The plant produces small, white flowers that emerge above the water surface, often in clusters. It thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater environments such as ponds and lakes. Its morphology and habitat make it an important species in aquatic ecosystems.
